reviews.review_msg: Professor Hackett is so knowledgeable on this subject, and his passion to always discover more about the changing media field totally comes through his lectures. He's not the easiest marker, but if you attend class and work hard, you can be successful. Also, he's completely open to feedback, which is great!
UGH! Such a hard marker.. out of our class of over 20 people, only ONE got an A+ and one got an A-. If you value high marks avoid this class at all costs..
Even gave us a freakin checklist for the final take home exam, very itty gritty and overly stubborn about the most minor things. Does not trust his students either, please please get out of SFU.
He is an extremely hard marker and boring. Unless you like to talk in class, don't take this course at all. Gpa dropper for sure.
DO NOT ever take CMNS 437 with him not only will it bring your GPA down but a lot of work is required weekly with the reading journals.
I don't think he is as boring as everyone says, but he is very serious and comes across as slightly arrogant. Don't volunteer your opinion if you fear him rejecting it.
A very serious prof indeed. Very VERY boring and definitely a hard marker.
Literally the most boring professor I have ever had, and a bit smug at times.  I don't comprehend how we could make such an interesting topic so unbearable.  Please retire.

A really nice guy.  Takes your complaints really seriously (aka he actually does something about it).  He's a little too left for my tastes.  Really smart and knows everything there is to know about cmns.  Hard marker at times.

Nawal is a caring prof, but as others have stated, very inflexible in terms of how students learn and is VERY opinionated (and will show). Problematic for dialogue as her politics can dominate and prevent deeper discussion. Sadly did not learn much from the course aside from the readings (from the early 2000s...) and quite dreaded the somber class.

At first I struggled in this class. But Sarah's feedback was very detailed and helped me to improve a lot. I also discussed questions I had in the office hours and she was very supportive and motivating which helped me so much. This was definitly the course I improved the most so far!

This course really grew on me. Sarah was enthusiastic and encouraging. She wanted us to improve and gave us plenty of opportunities. I understand she taught this particular course for the first time and she did a really great job. Would take the course with her again.
